statements: SELECT * FROM SoilSamples ORDER BY sample_date DESC
SELECT pH_level, moisture_content FROM SoilSamples WHERE pH_level > 5
SELECT sample_id, nutrient_levels FROM SoilSamples WHERE nutrient_levels->>'nitrogen' > '0.5'
SELECT * FROM SoilSamples WHERE sample_date >= '2022-01-01' AND sample_date <= '2022-12-31'
SELECT sample_id, pH_level, moisture_content FROM SoilSamples ORDER BY moisture_content DESC
SELECT * FROM SoilSamples ORDER BY sample_date DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT sample_id, pH_level, moisture_content FROM SoilSamples WHERE pH_level > 6 AND moisture_content < 0.5
SELECT sample_id, JSON_VALUE(nutrient_levels, '$.nitrogen') AS nitrogen_level FROM SoilSamples WHERE JSON_VALUE(nutrient_levels, '$.phosphorus') > 0.2
SELECT * FROM SoilSamples WHERE sample_date >= '2022-01-01' AND sample_date <= '2022-03-31' ORDER BY pH_level ASC
SELECT AVG(pH_level) AS avg_pH, MAX(moisture_content) AS max_moisture FROM SoilSamples WHERE sample_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30'
SELECT * FROM SoilSampleData;
SELECT soil_sample_id, ph_level, nutrient_levels FROM SoilSampleData WHERE moisture_content > 0.5;
SELECT * FROM AnalysisLog WHERE analyst_name = 'John Doe';
SELECT analysis_id, analysis_result FROM AnalysisLog ORDER BY sample_date DESC;
SELECT avg(ph_level) as avg_ph, avg(moisture_content) as avg_moisture FROM SoilSampleData;
SELECT * FROM SoilSampleData WHERE ph_level > 6.5
SELECT soil_sample_id, moisture_content FROM SoilSampleData ORDER BY moisture_content DESC
SELECT * FROM SoilSampleData WHERE nutrient_levels ->> 'nitrogen' > 'high'
SELECT * FROM SoilSampleData WHERE ph_level BETWEEN 5.0 AND 7.0 AND moisture_content < 30.0
SELECT s.soil_sample_id, a.analysis_result FROM SoilSampleData s JOIN AnalysisLog a ON s.soil_sample_id = a.analysis_id
SELECT * FROM soil_samples;
SELECT sample_id, location, pH_level FROM soil_samples ORDER BY pH_level DESC;
SELECT analysis_id, sample_id, analysis_date FROM analysis_results WHERE sample_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM comparisons WHERE comparison_result LIKE '%positive%';
SELECT * FROM soil_samples WHERE moisture_content < 0.5;
SELECT * FROM soil_samples;
SELECT sample_id, location FROM soil_samples WHERE pH_level > 7;
SELECT analysis_id, result_description, analysis_date FROM analysis_results ORDER BY analysis_date DESC;
SELECT sample_id, nutrient_levels->>'N' AS nitrogen_level FROM soil_samples;
SELECT * FROM comparisons WHERE comparison_result LIKE '%positive%' ORDER BY comparison_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM Soil_Samples;
SELECT sample_id, pH_levels, moisture_content FROM Soil_Samples ORDER BY sample_id DESC;
SELECT location_id, location FROM Sample_Location WHERE location = 'Farm A';
SELECT sample_id, JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT('pH', pH_levels, 'moisture', moisture_content) AS sample_info FROM Soil_Samples WHERE pH_levels > 6.5;
SELECT timestamp_id, timestamp FROM Sample_Timestamp WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT * FROM Soil_Samples WHERE pH_levels > 6.5;
SELECT sample_id, moisture_content FROM Soil_Samples WHERE moisture_content < 20;
SELECT location_id, location, sample_id FROM Sample_Location WHERE location LIKE 'Farm%';
SELECT * FROM Sample_Timestamp ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT analysis_id, analysis_type, analysis_result FROM Sample_Analysis WHERE analysis_type IN ('pH', 'Nutrient Levels');
SELECT * FROM SoilSamples;
SELECT location_name, location_id FROM SampleLocations;
SELECT researcher_name, researcher_id FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT analysis_date, sample_id FROM SampleAnalysis ORDER BY analysis_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM AnalysisResults WHERE parameter_name = 'pH Level';
SELECT * FROM SoilSamples;
SELECT sample_id, pH_level, moisture_content, nutrient_level FROM SoilSamples WHERE pH_level > 6 AND moisture_content < 0.5;
SELECT location_name, COUNT(sample_id) AS sample_count FROM SampleLocations INNER JOIN SoilSamples ON SampleLocations.location_id = SoilSamples.sample_id GROUP BY location_name;
SELECT researcher_name, analysis_date FROM Researchers INNER JOIN SampleAnalysis ON Researchers.researcher_id = SampleAnalysis.researcher_id ORDER BY analysis_date DESC;
SELECT parameter_name, AVG(value) AS average_value FROM AnalysisResults GROUP BY parameter_name HAVING AVG(value) > 10;
